property.name: text
property.value: Simulate the driver of the leading car. Output is the driver's desired speed.

property.name: text
property.value: Simulate a car that matches the desired speed using feedback control with a specified time constant.

property.name: text
property.value: Simulate a wireless network that corrupts the data when the fault input is true.

property.name: text
property.value: Simulate a car that attempts to detect faults in communication and adapt its behavior.

property.name: text
property.value: This model shows a simple adaptive cruise control system, illustrating model-integrated control strategies. A leading car model produces information that is observed with possible flaws by a following car. If the following car detects flaws, it uses a conservative strategy. Otherwise, it tracks the leading car closely.

svg.text: Author: Xiaoljun Liu and Edward A. Lee

property.name: text
property.value: Car simulator. This model takes as input a desired speed and implements a simple proportional controller with the specified loop gain to achieve that speed. It outputs the acceleration, speed, and position of the car.

property.name: text
property.value: In the normal mode, tokens at packetIn are passed unchanged to packetOut. In the faulty mode, the data in the packet is corrupted.

property.name: text
property.value: This fault channel model simply replaces the position with a constant -10.0.

property.name: text
property.value: Car simulator. This model takes as input a desired speed and implements a simple proportional controller with the specified loop gain to achieve that speed. It outputs the acceleration, speed, and position of the car.
